issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: clcwebport was added in 3.2.1 but package upgrade doesn't add it to console.ini

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
In testing the nightly builds, I have come across what appears to be a bug in the login for the 01/05 build:

http://pastebin.com/qKvKxK4w

I have verified that the credentials are correct by logging into the admin UI with them.
fields.summary: User Console logins fail after upgrade from 3.2.0 to 3.2.1

comments.body: I would like to reproduce this and ensure we don't log the sensitive information, and also understand what the problem is in the first place.

[~dkavanagh], do you have an update on this one?  

[~bthomason], is this still an issue with the latest build?
I can get on this if we need a fix for 3.2.1

I'm a little confused as to the issue here.  If we really are having login failures then this needs to be addressed, but I'm guessing that I would have heard more noises around this if still an issue, so I'm just trying to get status.

Thanks for jumping in Aaron.

The UI in 3.2.1 introduces a new config setting which, if absent, causes the UI to crash.

Matt may correct me if I'm wrong, but I believe users upgrading from 3.2 to 3.2.1 will be bit by this as the RPM upgrade will lay down a new conffile but not touch the old one.

If this is true, Release needs to sync with Docs to document this in the release notes.

I don't think we have login failures when using the right credentials. The
issue is more about when there are failures, we should not produce a log
message with sensitive information included.

Didn't we change the package spec to write the new file and backup the old?
Was that for 3.2.1 or 3.3?
We changed the package spec to _not_ overwrite the existing one since doing so on RHEL and friends is the exception, not the rule.  See EUCA-4603.

Ugh. I thought we did the opposite. If I had known, I could code around a
missing param, but cannot write the value into the file.
Can someone take a stab at the content we would like to add to the Docs for this?
[~dkavanagh], can you add a comment describing the issue for the Docs team so we can put something into the Known Issues list for this?

I think the issue relates to the "clcwebport" config value. The value was added to allow the link on the "about" dialog for the cloud admin portal to be generated correctly. In some cases (like with the ECC), the web UI was running on port 443, instead of 8443, so we needed a way to capture that for the user console's link to that.
The problem arrises when the user upgrades from 3.2 to a newer version (3.2.1 in this case) and we don't over-write the config file (/etc/eucalyptus-console/console.ini). The package installer puts the new file into another file (possibly same name with some suffix applied). The result is that the console server will not find the new value in the config file. We can code around this, but at the time, I thought we had started over-writing the config file and could expect to find that value always.
I could still code something to trap the exception and default to 8443 (as we do today). That would prevent this issue being visible to the user. If someone says "go". I'll get it done quickly.
Let's get the port fix on upgrade fixed for 3.2.2
[~dkavanagh], just want to make sure that you've got this on your radar to fix for 3.2.2.  We're looking to get fixes in by 3/7 at the latest.  Thanks!
Andy has a pull request for this specific problem. We could apply that in 3.2.2 and do something more comprehensive in 3.3

It's just a matter of coverage. The pull request addresses using a default for the one setting when that setting is not in the config file. I think that's great for this particular problem.
For improving troubleshootability, I would like to address this more broadly wherever values are being read, and log problems where we detect a mis-configuration.

Thanks.  Ok, then it sounds like pulling in Andy's fix for 3.2.2 is a good path forward.  Can you open up another Jira ticket then with the broader fix to address the troubleshootability? (I love that word)
[~dkavanagh], wanted to check with you on this one.  Code freeze is next week, 3/8.  Appreciate if you can update.
[~dkavanagh] whats the right way to test for this fix?

I think there are 2 options. 1 is to install 3.2, then 3.2.2 and try running the console. The other could be to install 3.2.2, edit the console.ini to remove the "clcwebport" entry (or comment it out) and try running the console.
The problem is when the config file lacks this value and the code expects it. The fix involves trapping the exception and using an acceptable default.
Tested as per DK's recommendations. All tested good. Approved fix for release.
3.2.2 has been released, moving this to Resolved.
